task.title: HSCSD Call Parameters Tutorial
task.shortdesc: This tutorial explains how to get and set the High Speed Circuit Switched Data (HSCSD) call parameters.

context.p: The HSCSD provides fast data services on 2G GSM networks by using multiple channel slots for a single call.

Parameters for HSCSD data calls are stored by the RMobileCall::TMobileHscsdCallParamsV1 class. The class inherits from RMobileCall::TMobileDataCallParamsV1, which in turn derives from RMobileCall::TMobileCallParamsV1, which in turn derives from RCall::TCallParams.

step.cmd: Send a package object to RCall::Dial() to set the call parameters for outbound calls.
Send the package object to RCall::AnswerIncomingCall() to set the parameters for inbound calls.
Use RCall::GetCallParams() to get the HSCSD parameters.
Use RMobileCall::SetDynamicHscsdParams() to dynamically change the HSCSD call parameters.
Use RMobileCall::GetCurrentHscsdInfo() to get the current HSCSD parameters of the call.
step.info: Parameters are returned in an RMobileCall::TMobileCallHscsdInfoV1 object.

step.cmd: Use RMobileCall::NotifyHscsdInfoChange() to get the notification of any network initiated changes to the HSCSD parameters.

example.title: HSCSD parameters example
example.p: The following code describes how to get the HSCD air interface user rate of a call.
